BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

What sets you apart from other Product Marketing Managers is you’re an excellent translator! You can speak with the Product team as if you are part of the Product team. You are a market expert and have a deep understanding of how Saas works, and your ability to take that knowledge and translate it into verbiage that helps your internal and external customers understand the value proposition you bring to them makes you an invaluable strategic partner on any team you are part of.
You are a whiz when it comes to conducting market research, developing comprehensive messaging documents, providing sales enablement tools and product feature training. You understand priorities and high-level requirements with the roadmap and clients’ needs.
You are an entrepreneur at heart. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with lots of change. You have experience working with high growth software organizations and your enthusiasm and ability to stay on task in stressful situations makes you someone people can count on both at work and in your personal life. Your natural communication approach is one that effectively, respectfully, and inclusively builds a sense of belonging among employees who differ from one another. You are a strategic thinker and are proactive problem solver and you find ways to cohesively support employees and business drivers.

Foundation Purpose
The Younique Foundation exists to eradicate child sexual abuse and its impacts. We provide healing educational retreats, support groups, and online healing resources for adult female survivors. Lastly, we know that this issue thrives in secrecy and silence, so we seek to grow public awareness of this silent epidemic. Our ultimate goal is to improve lives through the elimination of child sexual abuse.

At The Younique Foundation, we are committed to improving the world by working to eradicate child sexual abuse and its impacts. Additionally, the marketing leader will oversee a Community Care customer service team. This managerial position will report to the Chief Marketing Officer and will join his leadership staff. The Marketing Director will work collaboratively with the larger Awareness team (Creative, Video, and Communications), as well as other Foundation functional teams and executive leadership.

This position is located at Virginia Department of Corrections’ Headquarters in Richmond, Virginia. Richmond, the capital of Virginia, is among America’s oldest major cities. Richmond (“River City”) is east of the Blue Ridge Mountains and west of Virginia Beach.*_ Home of the University of Richmond and Virginia Commonwealth University, in recent years Richmond has become known for its culinary scene and vibrant neighborhoods. People enjoy Richmond’s easy access to the James River, state parks, hiking, and nearby beaches. Its stunning architecture, high-quality area schools, waterfront, and high walkability make Richmond an ideal destination._*
The Director of Communications serves as a key member of the Virginia Department of Corrections’ executive team and is accountable for advancing the Department’s mission, vision, values and public relations goals through building and strengthening relationships with diverse stakeholders within the communities we service and multifaceted partners we interact with on a regular basis. The position focuses on outreach activities and networking across the State in order to proactively generate media and/or special interest stories, effectively respond to media requests, and disseminate Department of Corrections news both externally and internally.
The Director of Communications is responsible for the planning and implementation of comprehensive agency-wide public relations program. Provides leadership and creativity in developing and managing programs, policy development, executing public and media relations programs, publications, customer service, marketing, public awareness, and other initiatives. Manages a small staff with responsibility for budget and program resources.

Extensive working knowledge of public relations and marketing practices including knowledge of media channels, technology, and community and citizen-based groups. Demonstrated excellence in management and leadership skills application, excellent communications skills (written and verbal) with employee base, and suitable for a community and media relations environment. Success in assessment, development, and implementation of complex and comprehensive public relations and/or marketing programs. Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Communications, Business Administration, Journalism, Political Science, or related field and extensive, progressively responsible experience in public relations or marketing or combination of equivalent education or experience.

Prefer Public Relations experience in a Governmental or Human Services setting. Prefer participation in appropriate Criminal Justice associations.

All applicants are subject to a background investigation and pre-employment drug screen.
The investigation may include: fingerprint checks (State Police, FBI); local agency checks; employment verification; verification of education (relevant to employment); credit checks; and other checks requested by the hiring authority.

Director of Marketing and Communications

Posting #: 3978
Position Status: Full-time regular
Location: San Diego
Position Type: Administrator, Joan B. Kroc School of Peace Studies
Position Title & Department: Director of Marketing and Communications; Kroc School of Peace Studies

Department Description:
We are a community of life-long learners focused on world-changing research, immersive training, and developing individuals' skills for shaping a better tomorrow. We put theory to action with a profound attention to the context and lived experiences of those affected by violence and injustice. As Joan B. Kroc said, "it's not enough to talk about peace — we must make peace by taking action." Since 2000, we have cultivated the courage and capacity in students to face the world's most pressing challenges with original thinking, moral imagination, practical skills and inspired research. Here, changemakers from countries all over the world connect and collaborate through learning that goes beyond papers and presentations. We roll up our sleeves together and take action. Here, you won't just talk about a crisis or world issues, you will learn how to apply critical theory and data to make meaningful change.


The University of San Diego, a contemporary and engaged Roman Catholic institution, was founded by the Diocese of San Diego and the Society of the Sacred Heart in 1949. Governed by an independent board of trustees since 1972, USD remains committed to a liberal arts education grounded in the Catholic intellectual tradition and the pursuit of truth, goodness and beauty. Inspired by this centuries old tradition of Catholic higher education, the University welcomes people of all faith traditions and any, or no, religious background. The future success of USD relies on the contributions of those who seek to foster the development of engaged global citizens and an earnest confrontation of humanity's urgent challenges.


The Director of Marketing and Communications (DMC) is a leadership position within the Kroc School. The DMC is a visionary, creative, mission-driven, and entrepreneurial individual with the expertise to lead distinctive marketing and communication initiatives that generate excitement about peace education and increase awareness of the School at the local, national and international level. The person in this role is responsible for leading the development and implementation of marketing, branding, communications (internal and external) and public relations strategies across the Kroc School. The DMC will develop and direct strategies to enhance the visibility and reputation of the Kroc School, and by extension the greater university, including all appropriate digital, print and interactive media. As the senior marketing and communications team member for the Kroc School, this individual will be responsible for the overarching strategy in marketing and communications to advance the mission and vision of the School as well as oversee and guide individual units' initiatives in this area.



Develop effective internal communications and outreach strategies.
Lead, drive, and oversee the implementation of both the Kroc School and units marketing, branding & PR plans to advance positioning and overall reputation in the long and short term.
Lead and oversee the Kroc School's comprehensive digital presence, with special attention to websites, social media and SEO, to enhance recruiting efforts, national and international reputation, development activities and alumni connections.
Develop processes to ensure that marketing strategies and plans are consistently in place for the Kroc School, and activities and outcomes are clearly defined.
Work closely with units and programs of the School to advise and guide their communications goals, branding and event planning.
Execute ongoing reviews of marketing and communications activities to ensure alignment with the Dean's initiatives and priorities.
Periodically review and revise strategy and plan as necessary to meet changing trends and best practices.
Present data and key performance measures (e.g., web traffic, digital marketing, media placements, etc.) evaluating effectiveness of current strategy and investments.
Articulate and document institutional positioning, brand promise and associated value propositions for all School stakeholders (current and prospective) for the College and individual departments/programs.
Manage and oversee event planning for Kroc School signature events.



Support the external promotion of faculty work, student scholarship and innovative programs in the School
Create and execute communication plans - research, writing, editing and design services across platforms - for internal and external stakeholders
Design, maintain and guide the implementations of a comprehensive, cohesive communications plan for different units and programs
Develop talking points, prepare power point presentations, etc. for the dean.



Lead the development of marketing skills and capabilities of relevant personnel in the School and individual programs (e.g. host workshops, one-on-one trainings, create guides and tutorials, etc.).
Represent the Kroc School and Dean's Office on various committees (CRM, Social Media, Community Relations/Outreach, among others).
Collaborate with university leadership and other marketing directors on initiatives, and advocate for the priorities of the School.
Serve as the central source of expertise and advice on all brand-related activities in the School.



Provide marketing support to the Dean, Kroc IPJ Executive Director, and Assistant Director of Development as needed.
Manage relationships and contracts with outside vendors on an as-needed basis.
Oversee the budget and expenses associated with the School's marketing and communication efforts.



Participate in the meetings of the School's Board of Advisors.
Attend key School events and participate in relevant university-wide activities.

Great Oaks Foundation, Inc.
The mission of the Great Oaks Foundation is to provide students with access to quality education through high-dosage tutoring.
ABOUT THE GO FOUNDATION
The Great Oaks (GO) Foundation is a non-profit organization that brings its model of high dosage tutoring to schools, from Maryland to Connecticut, with the mission of providing access to high-quality education for its students. The tutoring is provided by the Great Oaks AmeriCorps Fellows, which is a select cadre of recent college graduates who deliver individualized, small group instruction. This programming increases student achievement and builds a pipeline of teachers to work in Great Oaks and partner schools.
THE GREAT OAKS MODEL
The Great Oaks Foundation envisions an America where every child has the support of a tutor to enable them to realize their full human potential. Here is how Great Oaks will realize our vision and accomplish our mission:

At the Great Oaks (GO) Foundation, we recruit, train, and support a corps of service-oriented individuals who are placed in Great Oaks and partner schools where they intensively tutor students as a part of a year of service through the federal AmeriCorps program. We call our tutors to encompass the several roles they play to instruct, mentor and develop the students with whom they are matched.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. Position Title & Department: Director of Marketing and Communications; Kroc School of Peace Studies

Department Description:
We are a community of life-long learners focused on world-changing research, immersive training, and developing individuals' skills for shaping a better tomorrow. We put theory to action with a profound attention to the context and lived experiences of those affected by violence and injustice. As Joan B. Kroc said, "it's not enough to talk about peace — we must make peace by taking action." Since 2000, we have cultivated the courage and capacity in students to face the world's most pressing challenges with original thinking, moral imagination, practical skills and inspired research. Here, changemakers from countries all over the world connect and collaborate through learning that goes beyond papers and presentations. We roll up our sleeves together and take action. Here, you won't just talk about a crisis or world issues, you will learn how to apply critical theory and data to make meaningful change.


The University of San Diego, a contemporary and engaged Roman Catholic institution, was founded by the Diocese of San Diego and the Society of the Sacred Heart in 1949. Governed by an independent board of trustees since 1972, USD remains committed to a liberal arts education grounded in the Catholic intellectual tradition and the pursuit of truth, goodness and beauty. Inspired by this centuries old tradition of Catholic higher education, the University welcomes people of all faith traditions and any, or no, religious background. The future success of USD relies on the contributions of those who seek to foster the development of engaged global citizens and an earnest confrontation of humanity's urgent challenges.


The Director of Marketing and Communications (DMC) is a leadership position within the Kroc School. The DMC is a visionary, creative, mission-driven, and entrepreneurial individual with the expertise to lead distinctive marketing and communication initiatives that generate excitement about peace education and increase awareness of the School at the local, national and international level. The person in this role is responsible for leading the development and implementation of marketing, branding, communications (internal and external) and public relations strategies across the Kroc School. The DMC will develop and direct strategies to enhance the visibility and reputation of the Kroc School, and by extension the greater university, including all appropriate digital, print and interactive media. As the senior marketing and communications team member for the Kroc School, this individual will be responsible for the overarching strategy in marketing and communications to advance the mission and vision of the School as well as oversee and guide individual units' initiatives in this area.



Develop effective internal communications and outreach strategies.
Lead, drive, and oversee the implementation of both the Kroc School and units marketing, branding & PR plans to advance positioning and overall reputation in the long and short term.
Lead and oversee the Kroc School's comprehensive digital presence, with special attention to websites, social media and SEO, to enhance recruiting efforts, national and international reputation, development activities and alumni connections.
Develop processes to ensure that marketing strategies and plans are consistently in place for the Kroc School, and activities and outcomes are clearly defined.
Work closely with units and programs of the School to advise and guide their communications goals, branding and event planning.
Execute ongoing reviews of marketing and communications activities to ensure alignment with the Dean's initiatives and priorities.
Periodically review and revise strategy and plan as necessary to meet changing trends and best practices.
Present data and key performance measures (e.g., web traffic, digital marketing, media placements, etc.) evaluating effectiveness of current strategy and investments.
Articulate and document institutional positioning, brand promise and associated value propositions for all School stakeholders (current and prospective) for the College and individual departments/programs.
Manage and oversee event planning for Kroc School signature events.



Support the external promotion of faculty work, student scholarship and innovative programs in the School
Create and execute communication plans - research, writing, editing and design services across platforms - for internal and external stakeholders
Design, maintain and guide the implementations of a comprehensive, cohesive communications plan for different units and programs
Develop talking points, prepare power point presentations, etc. for the dean.



Lead the development of marketing skills and capabilities of relevant personnel in the School and individual programs (e.g. host workshops, one-on-one trainings, create guides and tutorials, etc.).
Represent the Kroc School and Dean's Office on various committees (CRM, Social Media, Community Relations/Outreach, among others).
Collaborate with university leadership and other marketing directors on initiatives, and advocate for the priorities of the School.
Serve as the central source of expertise and advice on all brand-related activities in the School.



Provide marketing support to the Dean, Kroc IPJ Executive Director, and Assistant Director of Development as needed.
Manage relationships and contracts with outside vendors on an as-needed basis.
Oversee the budget and expenses associated with the School's marketing and communication efforts.



Participate in the meetings of the School's Board of Advisors.
Attend key School events and participate in relevant university-wide activities.

Great Oaks Foundation, Inc.
The mission of the Great Oaks Foundation is to provide students with access to quality education through high-dosage tutoring.
ABOUT THE GO FOUNDATION
The Great Oaks (GO) Foundation is a non-profit organization that brings its model of high dosage tutoring to schools, from Maryland to Connecticut, with the mission of providing access to high-quality education for its students. The tutoring is provided by the Great Oaks AmeriCorps Fellows, which is a select cadre of recent college graduates who deliver individualized, small group instruction. This programming increases student achievement and builds a pipeline of teachers to work in Great Oaks and partner schools.
THE GREAT OAKS MODEL
The Great Oaks Foundation envisions an America where every child has the support of a tutor to enable them to realize their full human potential. Here is how Great Oaks will realize our vision and accomplish our mission:

At the Great Oaks (GO) Foundation, we recruit, train, and support a corps of service-oriented individuals who are placed in Great Oaks and partner schools where they intensively tutor students as a part of a year of service through the federal AmeriCorps program. We call our tutors to encompass the several roles they play to instruct, mentor and develop the students with whom they are matched.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

Corporate Overview:
We are a disruptive technology company seeking a Director of Marketing that possesses a competitive edge to keep up with our ever-evolving industry. Our company is a high-growth, fast-paced company with a big entrepreneurial spirit.
Under the corporate umbrella are subsidiary companies that target different corporate customers and offer unique services within the energy sector.
We offer full benefits free to our full-time employees, paid time off, and pride ourselves in a very comfortable and relaxed office atmosphere within our Healthy Life Balance motto. We work hard and we play hard. If you're seeking a unique company with an amazing opportunity full of fun and challenges, then by all means... come and join our party!

Summary
Phase2 is a digital product agency passionate about customer experience, grounded in data and insights, and rooted in 20 years of successful technology delivery. We make digital products that inspire, engage, and create impact. For the most influential companies in the world, Phase2 is a proven partner, guiding our clients toward what's next in the digital landscape.
The Partner Marketing Manager holds a key role at Phase2. Phase2 understands the benefit of technology, client-driven, and strategic partners. This role will not only leverage and optimize the different tiers and needs of the partner program, but will also seek out and evaluate new partners.
In addition to partnerships, this role also holds the responsibility for strategically guiding the partner events and industry event opportunities at Phase2. This includes a significant amount of teamwork with Sales, Accounts, and key Delivery leaders. Many activities must reach across several departments, making diplomatic coordination integral to success in the role.

The Director of Communications and Marketing (DCM) sets and guides the overall strategy for all communications, website, and public relations messages and collateral to consistently articulate the ABHMS core mission. The Director of Communications and Marketing works closely with a senior peer group (the Leadership Team and Program Directors) as a collaborative partner on a variety of strategic initiatives designed to advance the ABHMS core missional strategy.

Position Description

Primary Responsibilities
The role represents an exciting and broad opportunity to make a difference across our entire organization and community. The role spans a wide variety of tasks each week and month, which are likely to include:

Great Oaks Foundation, Inc.
The mission of the Great Oaks Foundation is to provide students with access to quality education through high-dosage tutoring.
ABOUT THE GO FOUNDATION
The Great Oaks (GO) Foundation is a non-profit organization that brings its model of high dosage tutoring to schools, from Maryland to Connecticut, with the mission of providing access to high-quality education for its students. The tutoring is provided by the Great Oaks AmeriCorps Fellows, which is a select cadre of recent college graduates who deliver individualized, small group instruction. This programming increases student achievement and builds a pipeline of teachers to work in Great Oaks and partner schools.
THE GREAT OAKS MODEL
The Great Oaks Foundation envisions an America where every child has the support of a tutor to enable them to realize their full human potential. Here is how Great Oaks will realize our vision and accomplish our mission:

At the Great Oaks (GO) Foundation, we recruit, train, and support a corps of service-oriented individuals who are placed in Great Oaks and partner schools where they intensively tutor students as a part of a year of service through the federal AmeriCorps program. We call our tutors to encompass the several roles they play to instruct, mentor and develop the students with whom they are matched.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story.

Chief Marketing Officer
Vision & Strategy
The CMO will be responsible for providing and maintaining a powerful, industry-dominating strategy. They will address this challenge with several of the best-known strategic concepts into one comprehensive framework. They will create and maintain a competition-crushing, differentiated approach to our market. They will recommend resources to bolster the team’s understanding of each stratum. This will be hard work and will require collaboration with the executive team aka “the council”.
The council members, including the CMO, are expected to spend time each week talking with customers and employees and checking out competitors, extracting insights and ideas to fuel their strategic thinking.

About Us:
Tactical Sports Brands
We are a small team with an exciting fast-growth minded culture serving the Firearms and Tactical Goods market across a handful of e-commerce brands.
We are looking for growth minded, enthusiastic individuals who want to be part of building something special and get in on the ground floor.
Tactical Sports Brands hires smart, humble, and hard-working people and empowers them to create maximum impact for themselves and others. Our self-managed work environment gives people the opportunity and responsibility to create a fulfilling career while empowering them to do meaningful work.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

CanvasPrints.com seeks a Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) who will lead CanvasPrints’ marketing and branding strategy for the overall organization, its content, and its products (e.g., CanvasPrints.com, Wholesale Products and CanvasPrints iOS and Google Play Apps) with an emphasis on growing national awareness of our products.
The CMO will be thrilled by the challenge of making CanvasPrints.com a household name. Specifically, the position will oversee CanvasPrints’ overall branding and messaging across all of its external communications; grow engagement and reach on social media; envision and broker high-visibility partnerships for our content--especially our product placements; and lead both content strategies, paid marketing such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Pinterest and many others.
The CMO will also work closely with the product teams to implement new products, take on new product initiatives working directly with the head of product as well as production teams to assure all facets of marketing messaging is applied throughout the customer journey.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

What sets you apart from other Product Marketing Managers is you’re an excellent translator! You can speak with the Product team as if you are part of the Product team. You are a market expert and have a deep understanding of how Saas works, and your ability to take that knowledge and translate it into verbiage that helps your internal and external customers understand the value proposition you bring to them makes you an invaluable strategic partner on any team you are part of.
You are a whiz when it comes to conducting market research, developing comprehensive messaging documents, providing sales enablement tools and product feature training. You understand priorities and high-level requirements with the roadmap and clients’ needs.
You are an entrepreneur at heart. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with lots of change. You have experience working with high growth software organizations and your enthusiasm and ability to stay on task in stressful situations makes you someone people can count on both at work and in your personal life. Your natural communication approach is one that effectively, respectfully, and inclusively builds a sense of belonging among employees who differ from one another. You are a strategic thinker and are proactive problem solver and you find ways to cohesively support employees and business drivers.

Summary
Phase2 is a digital product agency passionate about customer experience, grounded in data and insights, and rooted in 20 years of successful technology delivery. We make digital products that inspire, engage, and create impact. For the most influential companies in the world, Phase2 is a proven partner, guiding our clients toward what's next in the digital landscape.
The Partner Marketing Manager holds a key role at Phase2. Phase2 understands the benefit of technology, client-driven, and strategic partners. This role will not only leverage and optimize the different tiers and needs of the partner program, but will also seek out and evaluate new partners.

Uvalle Law Firm, PLLC is a a fast-paced, high-volume personal injury law firm that seeks an extremely energetic marketing individual to serve as its Chief Marketing Officer. This position will be responsible for developing, managing and implementing marketing and brand projects within the firm. This role will contribute to the long-term strategic development of the firm and its overall growth and expansion.
A strong Chief Marketing Officer should have the capabilities to drive awareness and demand for the brand through all marketing channels. The ideal candidates should have a strong understanding of both the creative and analytical side of traditional marketing channels (TV, radio, outdoor) and digital marketing channels, including but not limited to SEO/SEM, social & influencer marketing strategy, digital advertising, and overall growth marketing strategies in order to drive awareness, consideration, and conversion for multiple brands.

Founded in Tallahassee, Florida in 2018, F&I Sentinel (“FIS”) is a fast-growing tech-enabled service provider to some of the largest automotive finance companies in the United States. At FIS, our mission is to protect consumers, finance companies, and retail sellers through the facilitation of a compliant finance and insurance (“F&I”) product marketplace and integration of FIS into the automotive financing ecosystem. Since its inception, the company has experienced explosive growth in a short period seeing growth rates of more than 75% year over year since the company was founded.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, theChief Marketing Officer will provide hands-on leadership and assist the company with building out its marketing team. In addition to building and overseeing the company’s in-house marketing team, the CMO will retain and manage an external public relations firm to assist with building FIS’s brand and telling the company’s story.

Our new mobile app is designed to help pet parents manage their pet’s health and wellness throughout their life’s journey. We take a lifestyle approach to pet wellness, with 24/7 virtual access to US-licensed veterinarians and a personalized, guided experience to help create healthy habits and joyful pets.
AskVet provides pet parents with the ultimate team of experts ready to support them and anticipate their pet’s daily needs. The AskVet Care Squad can tackle anything from wellness, nutrition, and behavior to chronic conditions, new puppies, senior issues and everything in between! Leading a healthy lifestyle is just as important for our pet as it is for ourselves, and can be equally challenging—we make it easy.

$175k - $225k
Billion $$$ global Hospitality and Food & Beverage conglomerate now seeks entrepreneur responsible for the creation, coordination, and execution of marketing plans across a diverse range of hospitality, culinary and dining experiences. Seeking 6+ years strategic marketing within the food and beverage or hospitality industry. (Any advertising agency experience a plus.) Must be experienced in marketing, digital marketing as well as event marketing. Position will communicate across operations, strategic partnerships, various Food & Beverage teams (both internal & external), as well as executive leadership. Responsible for development of the culinary marketing strategy and how that is executed focusing on PR planning and outreach, events & activations, digital media and advertising, promotions and loyalty, new openings, and reporting. Responsible for working with existing partners in the high-end culinary platform. Responsible for building out new culinary platforms, community programs as well as building events, promotions and partnerships around specific seasonal campaigns increasing the success of the Food & Beverage ventures. Responsible for strategic partnerships to ensure proper integrations of corporate brand partners in product offerings, menus, and in events, promotions and existing experiences. Develop and execute consumer advertising and promotion plans to drive brand awareness, engagement and guest reservations across all hospitality assets. Work closely with internal and external creative teams to ensure the success of all assets. Lead activations and partnership programs from a consumer marketing perspective. Work closely with key stakeholders; updating on initiatives and marketing plans. Manage strategic/marketing budget including building annual budget with key stakeholders; as well as tracking and analyzing expenses and working closely with accounting department. Generate and outline planned campaigns and activities. Research and advise on best practices, appropriate media channels, new marketing opportunities and providing competitive analysis. Provide regular reporting including monthly brand audits, reporting (monthly & quarterly) against goals and objectives using appropriate metrics. Liaise with Digital Marketing and Social Media Managers across the organization to ensure marketing campaigns are supported across all channels to determine success of initiatives. Must have strong communication, writing, presentation, creativity with entrepreneurial experience. MS Suite & Social media platform experience. Any Adobe, Salesforce and Google Analytics experience a plus. Ability to communicate with the world's finest Chefs.

Overview
It is an exciting time to join The Wendy’s Company! Wendy's and its franchisees operate ~6,800 restaurants in more than 30 countries and U.S. territories with a vision of becoming the world’s most thriving and beloved restaurant brand. New market expansion, growth of our digital channels, and expanding into the breakfast business will continue to be dominant drivers of Wendy’s growth strategy over the coming years.
To further this vision, we're looking for a customer-obsessed, hands-on, Associate Brand Manager (ABM). As an ABM at Wendy’s, you will provide detailed project management and coordination of cross-functional and agency partners in support of assigned objectives and business category. By leveraging data and insights, you will assist in the development of key marketing initiatives to achieve objectives, including development of annual brand plans, marketing strategies and communications, consumer and industry analyses, and product innovations. As a growth driver within your product category, you will develop, test, and implement product and promotional initiatives to support national marketing campaigns.

Your Job
We are hiring a Procurement Director that will set the strategic direction of the global Procure-to-pay (P2P) function and lead a team consisting of 8 professionals (and growing) in multiple offices around the globe.

This leader will be the sourcing expert for Marketing categories. They will be responsible for liaising with legal, acting as the Procurement ambassador to the business to ensure complete alignment and a deep understanding of business goals while partnering to develop sourcing strategies. The goal is to be a value-added sourcing partner to the business. This individual will manage a team of Sr. Category Managers, Category Managers and Category Specialists and will ensure that their business owners are supported in a fast-paced, tight deadlines environment.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

ABOUT THE BUSINESS:
Founded in Tallahassee, Florida in 2018, F&I Sentinel (“FIS”) is a fast-growing tech-enabled service provider to some of the largest automotive finance companies in the United States. At FIS, our mission is to protect consumers, finance companies, and retail sellers through the facilitation of a compliant finance and insurance (“F&I”) product marketplace and integration of FIS into the automotive financing ecosystem. Since its inception, the company has experienced explosive growth in a short period seeing growth rates of more than 75% year over year since the company was founded.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, theChief Marketing Officer will provide hands-on leadership and assist the company with building out its marketing team. In addition to building and overseeing the company’s in-house marketing team, the CMO will retain and manage an external public relations firm to assist with building FIS’s brand and telling the company’s story.

About us
AskVet is the world’s leader in virtual pet care. Founded in 2014 we have held over 1 million virtual consultations with pet owners and our team of 24/7 veterinarians.
Our new mobile app is designed to help pet parents manage their pet’s health and wellness throughout their life’s journey. We take a lifestyle approach to pet wellness, with 24/7 virtual access to US-licensed veterinarians and a personalized, guided experience to help create healthy habits and joyful pets.
AskVet provides pet parents with the ultimate team of experts ready to support them and anticipate their pet’s daily needs. The AskVet Care Squad can tackle anything from wellness, nutrition, and behavior to chronic conditions, new puppies, senior issues and everything in between! Leading a healthy lifestyle is just as important for our pet as it is for ourselves, and can be equally challenging—we make it easy.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

What sets you apart from other Product Marketing Managers is you’re an excellent translator! You can speak with the Product team as if you are part of the Product team. You are a market expert and have a deep understanding of how Saas works, and your ability to take that knowledge and translate it into verbiage that helps your internal and external customers understand the value proposition you bring to them makes you an invaluable strategic partner on any team you are part of.
You are a whiz when it comes to conducting market research, developing comprehensive messaging documents, providing sales enablement tools and product feature training. You understand priorities and high-level requirements with the roadmap and clients’ needs.
You are an entrepreneur at heart. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with lots of change. You have experience working with high growth software organizations and your enthusiasm and ability to stay on task in stressful situations makes you someone people can count on both at work and in your personal life. Your natural communication approach is one that effectively, respectfully, and inclusively builds a sense of belonging among employees who differ from one another. You are a strategic thinker and are proactive problem solver and you find ways to cohesively support employees and business drivers.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

Our Team is seeking someone who is passionate about NYC real estate and technology. We are seeking a Marketing Director to lead the marketing and advertising rollout of LavaMap’s two new products: The 3D App and the Real Deal Listings platform. The Marketing Director will focus on working with graphic designers and product managers to create and strategically promote content to drive users to these two new products. Content is expected to range from Email Drip Campaigns, Web content campaigns, Social Media Campaigns, and traditional print and mailing campaigns. As well as sales decks and marketing materials.
Who we are at LavaMap:
LavaMap is a PropTech company that's disrupting real estate search engines. We are a team of technerds and real estate sharks that obsess over innovative search tools, predictive modeling, and 3D listing tours. Our mission is to help searchers find the best places to live and invest. We believe by providing a dynamic platform to share and learn, we can promote a smarter evolution of cities, globally. We equip industry professionals with the tools to effectively broker and sell their properties and the research to make wiser investment decisions. We are driven to be the leaders of the information technology renaissance in real estate

Our Customer’s mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through their family of apps and services, they are building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together.
We are seeking a Product Marketing Manager on a contract basis to help and support our client's ongoing business needs.

What you’ll do:
Lead market assessment based on quantitative analysis, qualitative feedback, and market view

Identify and evaluate long-term opportunities based on research, quantitative analysis, deep understanding of technologies, and a strategic view of the industry and its business models

Collaborate with product managers, synthesize insights to develop actionable product strategies and investment recommendations to execute on

Articulate and validate partner value proposition and establish a quantitative business case (i.e. ROI/TCO/NPV)

Develop a go-to-market strategy (market prioritization, pipeline, goals)

Create positioning collateral (i.e. pitch, objection handling, case studies)

Be a part of cross-functional planning and execution to support product launches and scaled adoption efforts globally


Develop product and partner growth playbook in partnership with Product, Data Science, and other teams (i.e. growth levers, tactics, prioritization, metrics)

Manage pilots (i.e. define scope, roll-out strategy, recruit partners and support evaluation of results)

Support Partnerships teams globally as a subject matter expert to enable partner success and best practices adoption

Partner with Marketing and other cross-functional teams to scale adoption through channel partners and drive key outbound marketing activities (i.e. participation in key industry events)


5-10 years of experience working in product marketing, product management, management consulting, product strategy, or equivalent function (partnered with product management and/or engineering on strategy and go-to-market).

Quantitative analytical experience in decision-making with large data sets and quantitative analysis.

Experience as an enterprise product marketer.

Experience influencing and developing strategic partnership products and programs at a global scale.

Experience collaborating and leading cross-functionally, including building consensus among multiple stakeholders in an entrepreneurial, high-expectation environment.

Highly organized, a resourceful and action-oriented individual with experience driving focus, clarity, and prioritization.

Communication and presentation skills.

Experience in the field of connectivity.

Outbound marketing skills.

Brand management skills.

Technical management skills.


BS/BA degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or related discipline.

MBA preferred.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

Responsibilities:
Manage timely execution of seasonal marketing programs, overseeing relationships and internal communication with all cross-functional partners, including sales planning, sales operations, creative, PR and Education
Own, monitor and maintain on-time delivery of critical project milestones
Develop strategies to grow existing product lines, in store and digitally; providing recommendations to senior management
Survey competitive landscape to develop best-in-class programs by identifying trends and current and emerging competitors
Build and maintain effective and strong relationships with contract manufacturers and 3rd party vendors

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. Since its inception, the company has experienced explosive growth in a short period seeing growth rates of more than 75% year over year since the company was founded.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will play an important role in building awareness and adoption of BCG’s marketing and business development technologies, with a core focus on Microsoft Dynamics CRM. These tools are critical to delivering more personalized experiences, promoting transparency and collaboration, and generating actionable insights in support of BCG’s strategic objectives.
You will offer thought partnership and execution in three areas: 1) Audience Management Technology program strategy, implementation and program measurement, 2) Engagement with speciality business, account teams, and marketing teams to promote effective use of tools, 3) Contribute to Audience Management offerings and tool development.
You will do this while collaborating with Marketing teams, Speciality Businesses, and BCG account teams, and Global Client Team. Day-to-day activities will be spread primarily across the following areas:
Marketing Technologies is led by Alejandro Meyer (MDP) and Leslie Spengler (Senior Director, Marketing Technologies).

On a day-to-day basis, you will support the change program for Audience Management tools, including the onboarding of new teams, under the leadership of your Line Manager and other Marketing & Business Development Technologies team resources. Program results are reported to Sharon Marcil - Global Client Team and Marketing Chair - and shared with the Executive Committee.

Organization: Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB)
Position: Marketing Manager
Location: New York, NY/Telecommute/Remote
Reports to: Senior Vice President, Marketing & Communications
Are you a motivated and analytical marketing professional? Come join the non-profit organization that helps consumers make informed choices about video games and apps. The Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) is the self-regulatory body that assigns ratings for the video game industry. ESRB is seeking a Marketing Manager to manage various ESRB marketing initiatives. This position is currently remote due to COVID-19, with generous and flexible telecommute options post-COVID. Candidates local to NYC are preferred but individuals outside the Tri-State area will be considered for a remote opportunity. ESRB offers a competitive salary and bonus with excellent benefits and work environment.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

Your Job
Indeed is searching for a Marketing Analytics Manager to join our team in Austin, TX or remote. This new member would be part of a fast-paced Brand Strategy and Insights team that consists of campaign planning, full-cycle research to support insight generation, and the measurement of campaign outcomes to optimize and improve the returns on our brand investment. In this role, you will partner with key stakeholders such as Global Advertising, PR, and Creative to develop a strong measurement strategy combining analytical insights and business acumen to improve the return on our brand marketing investments across channels. Although this role sits within the marketing organization, we collaborate with teams across Indeed to help drive our business forward and by measuring progress against our KPIs.

We are looking for an experienced marketing analytics professional with a data-centric mindset to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, with a proven aptitude and desire to drive marketing efficiencies through data-driven decisions and automation. You will ensure proper collection of data across different marketing departments to understand their KPIs and help them analyze their results by providing insights into what is working, what isn’t, and how we can action off our learnings to ensure continuous improvement.

Reporting to the Chief HR Officer, the Director of Corporate Communications will serve as a key member of the Regal HR leadership team. This is a hands-on role that is responsible for developing and executing strategic, global internal and external communications plans and activities to drive associate engagement and alignment to Regal’s Business System (RBS)—which includes our Values/ Purpose/ Mission/ Vision, DEI strategy, talent acquisition & retention and business priorities—to excite potential job candidates and to inspire customer loyalty and investor confidence.
This subject matter expert will be responsible for partnering with the various HR Centers of Excellence (i.e., Talent Acquisition, DEI, Segment HR leaders) to build and implement communications strategies that outline Regal’s value proposition to external candidates, build the company’s reputation as an employer of choice and position Regal as a leader in the markets we serve.
With guidance from the CHRO, VP of Talent and HRLT, the Director of Corporate Communication will play a central role in designing and implementing the global internal engagement strategy to advance the alignment of our 20,000 global associates to the company’s strategy and culture.
In partnership with the VP Investor Relations, along with other key leadership team members, this role will also support external communication of key Regal messages, including our Annual Report and annual Sustainability Report. This role will also manage all corporate related webpage communication.
This leader will promote strong communications and collaborate with Regal’s four global business segments, corporate executives and the CEO.
This is an exciting leadership opportunity for a hands-on experienced leader who has deep subject matter expertise and a desire to build a communications framework that delivers measurable value.
Key Responsibilities
