Job Title: Senior Director, Brand Strategy and Marketing Communications
Job Description:
Why you?
Are you a seasoned brand steward and natural storyteller with experience translating customer insights into a robust creative strategy? Do you serve as the strategic voice for creative, product and marketing teams? Are you able to identify the needs of the consumer and weave those insights into a company’s products and communications to tell a clear and compelling story? Do you dig high-growth startup life and all the challenges and rewards associated with operating in that fast-paced, ever-changing environment? Are you ready to roll up your sleeves and do the work? If so, we’d like to speak with you!
Why us?
The Mom Project is a pioneering, remote-first venture-backed startup with roots in Chicago & Cincinnati. We are backed by some of the best investors in the world and are lucky to be surrounded by an incredible team of advisors, including Serena Williams. The Mom Project is a platform and community leading a movement that matches companies with diverse talent. This critical match drives businesses forward while expanding professional opportunities for women.
Our team is growing as we push to rewrite the narrative for working women at every stage of life. We believe women should be able to choose both a successful family life AND career aspirations without sacrificing one over the other. Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience drives us and our mission forward every day. We strive towards inclusion and that means everyone is comfortable bringing their authentic and best self to work every day.


The Mom Project is looking for a Senior Director, Brand Strategy and Marketing Communications to define and drive The Mom Project’s brand, positioning, and creative communications. We are looking for someone who can work effectively with stakeholders across the organization to develop impactful marketing strategies in service to our core goal: unlocking economic opportunity for working moms.


Set the agenda for brand strategy to include creation of brand messaging architecture and themes to deliver compelling messages to both our B2B and B2C customers, uncovering whitespace opportunities and transforming how The Mom Project is experienced both internally and externally.

Lead and expand a nimble team responsible for the company’s brand strategy, customer insights, and social and PR communications.

Be a brand evangelist and influence company leadership and cross-functional teams, ensuring our holistic brand strategy is reflected in work, activities, and products.

Analyze and contextualize market trends and customer behavior to inform strategy and creative development.

Be well-attuned to cultural changes and their impact on our business, brand health, and customer perception.

Collaborate with creative teams to deliver creative briefings that incorporate customer and market insights and guide the development of compelling marketing communications.

Drive and apply strategy across diverse, concurrent campaigns and partnerships.

Achieve trusted advisor status with stakeholders and partners by providing deep insights and collaboration.


12+ years of experience as a brand planner or strategist at a brand or creative agency, or internal brand-based team

8+ years of experience with team leadership, team building, or team management

5+ years brand strategy leadership experience

Experience building and evolving brand strategies and architectures for both B2B and B2C brands, ability to establish brand guardrails, strategic frameworks and brand-level narratives.

Proven experience developing, and establishing executive alignment on, short and long-term strategies

The ability to synthesize large amount of data into actionable insights

Skilled at driving the big pictures and overarching mission, but also willing to roll up your sleeves and do the work.

Full medical, dental, vision

Short and Long Term Disability

Generous Paid Parental Leave

Family planning benefits through Progyny

Generous PTO

401K match

Let me see those Perks, Perks, Perks !

An incredible remote team that will support and champion your work

Health and Wellness stipend

Learning and Development stipend

Work From Home Stipend

Job Title: Senior Director, Brand Strategy and Marketing Communications
Job Description:
Why you?
Are you a seasoned brand steward and natural storyteller with experience translating customer insights into a robust creative strategy? Do you serve as the strategic voice for creative, product and marketing teams? Are you able to identify the needs of the consumer and weave those insights into a company’s products and communications to tell a clear and compelling story? Do you dig high-growth startup life and all the challenges and rewards associated with operating in that fast-paced, ever-changing environment? Are you ready to roll up your sleeves and do the work? If so, we’d like to speak with you!
Why us?
The Mom Project is a pioneering, remote-first venture-backed startup with roots in Chicago & Cincinnati. We are backed by some of the best investors in the world and are lucky to be surrounded by an incredible team of advisors, including Serena Williams. The Mom Project is a platform and community leading a movement that matches companies with diverse talent. This critical match drives businesses forward while expanding professional opportunities for women.
Our team is growing as we push to rewrite the narrative for working women at every stage of life. We believe women should be able to choose both a successful family life AND career aspirations without sacrificing one over the other. Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion across race, gender, age, religion, identity, and experience drives us and our mission forward every day. We strive towards inclusion and that means everyone is comfortable bringing their authentic and best self to work every day.


The Mom Project is looking for a Senior Director, Brand Strategy and Marketing Communications to define and drive The Mom Project’s brand, positioning, and creative communications. We are looking for someone who can work effectively with stakeholders across the organization to develop impactful marketing strategies in service to our core goal: unlocking economic opportunity for working moms.


Set the agenda for brand strategy to include creation of brand messaging architecture and themes to deliver compelling messages to both our B2B and B2C customers, uncovering whitespace opportunities and transforming how The Mom Project is experienced both internally and externally.

Lead and expand a nimble team responsible for the company’s brand strategy, customer insights, and social and PR communications.

Be a brand evangelist and influence company leadership and cross-functional teams, ensuring our holistic brand strategy is reflected in work, activities, and products.

Analyze and contextualize market trends and customer behavior to inform strategy and creative development.

Be well-attuned to cultural changes and their impact on our business, brand health, and customer perception.

Collaborate with creative teams to deliver creative briefings that incorporate customer and market insights and guide the development of compelling marketing communications.

Drive and apply strategy across diverse, concurrent campaigns and partnerships.

Achieve trusted advisor status with stakeholders and partners by providing deep insights and collaboration.


12+ years of experience as a brand planner or strategist at a brand or creative agency, or internal brand-based team

8+ years of experience with team leadership, team building, or team management

5+ years brand strategy leadership experience

Experience building and evolving brand strategies and architectures for both B2B and B2C brands, ability to establish brand guardrails, strategic frameworks and brand-level narratives.

Proven experience developing, and establishing executive alignment on, short and long-term strategies

The ability to synthesize large amount of data into actionable insights

Skilled at driving the big pictures and overarching mission, but also willing to roll up your sleeves and do the work.


Base Compensation

Full medical, dental, vision

Short and Long Term Disability

Generous Paid Parental Leave

Family planning benefits through Progyny

Generous PTO

401K match

Let me see those Perks, Perks, Perks !

An incredible remote team that will support and champion your work

Health and Wellness stipend

Learning and Development stipend

Work From Home Stipend

Experience in GTM initiatives and partnering with product teams will further drive success in this role.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Global Email Marketing (100% Remote)
Job Description:
Who We Are:
Our Clients Customer Experience and Marketing organization serves, inspires, and delights customers – and helps others in our organization do the same. From the simplest interaction on our website to how people take in our advertising and communications, we are obsessed with delivering value. We know our customers’ needs, and we strive to exceed their expectations. Touching every element of the business, we’re here to grow and build their brand, reach new audiences and offer the best possible experience for every customer.
As a Senior Manager, Global Email Marketing, you will be responsible for leading a large team to develop campaign and customer strategies across North America and International markets that increase customer engagement, drive retention, and LTV. On the front lines of our journey to customer-centricity, you will leverage personalization and relevancy to deliver the most unforgettable customer experience in email in support of our upper-level organizational objective to become a partner for small businesses across the world.


Lead the transformation of the global email marketing program in support of a best in class, audience-centric, highly personalized program by establishing a templatized automated framework and process that supports our high bar of creative expression and delivers relevant customer communications and long-term customer value and engagement

Lead a large global team of marketing managers and specialists in a matrixed environment to strategize, develop and deliver best in class data-driven email marketing strategy and roadmap plans across 15+ global markets

Forecast expectations, manage channel P&L, closely monitor and provide regular performance updates across various KPIs with a focus on story-telling/ drawing conclusions from data and levering these insights to optimize program strategy and campaign plans

Work in partnership with Country Directors, Go-to-Market, Brand, CRM and Creative teams to create engaging email strategies in support of upper-level organizational and channel priorities that deliver value, exceed KPI expectations and deliver industry-leading customer experiences

Develop a channel roadmap that delivers value and delights the customer; ensure a strong partnership with key stakeholders including the Personalization team to ensure we are aligning on the most exciting opportunities to deliver the impactful customer communications and your programs support evangelization and optimization of broader team advancements

Advance our understanding of “what works” by designing and analyzing A/B and multivariate tests in support of robust learning agenda across all channel variables (ex. content, frequency, audience, offer, etc.)

Inspire, motivate and mentor a large team of direct reports in various locations across the globe to deliver on key outcomes/initiatives while creating meaningful career paths and growth opportunities


Our Clients value the experiences that individual team members add to our culture. Please don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications, we look forward to learning more about you!

University degree in marketing or another relevant area

7+ years of experience working in digital strategy, with direct experience managing highly complex, personalized, and data-driven email marketing programs at an e-commerce organization

3-5 years of direct management experience with responsibility for delivering results through others, managing career growth, and inspiring teams to deliver exceptional outcomes

Experience & strong comfortability managing to P&L, monitoring and reporting on KPIs, and providing performance updates to executive level management

Ability to flawlessly manage multiple complex initiatives at once with full control and understanding of the minute details with the ability to package into executive-level commentary

Strong relationship-building skills, specifically with executive-level team members


Being with our client means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk, or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.


As an e-commerce powerhouse, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We are the marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For more than 20 years, we have helped small businesses look and feel credible through high-quality marketing products and solutions that include signage, logo apparel, promotional products, face masks, flyers, postcards, business cards, websites, and digital marketing. With us, small businesses are able to create and customize their marketing with easy-to-use digital tools and design templates, or by receiving expert graphic design support. In 2020, We acquired 99designs to expand its design offering via a worldwide community of more than 150,000 talented designers to make it easy for designers and clients to work together to create designs they love. We are focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online, and on the go.

Indeed is the world’s #1 job site1 with over 25 million global monthly unique visitors2 and helps over 3 million companies worldwide hire great talent. About us
AskVet is the world’s leader in virtual pet care. Founded in 2014 we have held over 1 million virtual consultations with pet owners and our team of 24/7 veterinarians.
Our new mobile app is designed to help pet parents manage their pet’s health and wellness throughout their life’s journey. We take a lifestyle approach to pet wellness, with 24/7 virtual access to US-licensed veterinarians and a personalized, guided experience to help create healthy habits and joyful pets.
AskVet provides pet parents with the ultimate team of experts ready to support them and anticipate their pet’s daily needs. The AskVet Care Squad can tackle anything from wellness, nutrition, and behavior to chronic conditions, new puppies, senior issues and everything in between! Leading a healthy lifestyle is just as important for our pet as it is for ourselves, and can be equally challenging—we make it easy.

Yelp for Restaurants is seeking an experienced growth and/or demand gen leader to build and oversee our Yelp for Restaurants demand generation practice as we move from an outbound sales engine to a marketing-led growth motion.
In 2020, Yelp launched Yelp for Restaurants. We’re Yelp’s internal startup that sells operational SaaS products directly to restaurants. Since then, thousands of restaurants have accepted millions of reservations, waitlist entries, and takeout orders with our standout Guest Manager product. This role would join the marketing leadership team of that business unit and be responsible for the strategy and execution of our web, paid media, lifecycle, nurture, events, and growth experiment programs. You would report to the Head of Restaurants Marketing and inherit a team already sourcing a high percentage of new customers.
As Yelp for Restaurant’s growth marketing leader, you will develop the campaigns, channels, and measurement strategy to grow market share with local and mid-market restaurants. You’ll be responsible for finding ways to accelerate acquisition through close partnerships with sales, marketing and product leadership. You’ll have support from a wide range of peer organizations - from infrastructure and ops to analytics and data science. You’ll play the lead in our effort to make restaurants more aware of Yelp for Restaurants’ offering and turning awareness into intent.

SUMMARY

Your Job
Indeed is searching for a Marketing Analytics Manager to join our team in Austin, TX or remote. This new member would be part of a fast-paced Brand Strategy and Insights team that consists of campaign planning, full-cycle research to support insight generation, and the measurement of campaign outcomes to optimize and improve the returns on our brand investment. In this role, you will partner with key stakeholders such as Global Advertising, PR, and Creative to develop a strong measurement strategy combining analytical insights and business acumen to improve the return on our brand marketing investments across channels. Although this role sits within the marketing organization, we collaborate with teams across Indeed to help drive our business forward and by measuring progress against our KPIs.

We are looking for an experienced marketing analytics professional with a data-centric mindset to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, with a proven aptitude and desire to drive marketing efficiencies through data-driven decisions and automation. You will ensure proper collection of data across different marketing departments to understand their KPIs and help them analyze their results by providing insights into what is working, what isn’t, and how we can action off our learnings to ensure continuous improvement.

Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. HCP, AHP and patient) and detailed execution of promotional tactics working in close collaboration with partners, including: the sales force, brand team, the partner company, vendors, thought leaders, professional societies, among others. Specific responsibilities will evolve based on the needs of the brand and franchise, lifecycle of the brand, and competencies required on specific projects.



Financial performance (market share, units, profitability)

Job Title: Associate Director, ESPN Films Content Integration
Job Description:
Job Summary:
The Associate Director, ESPN Original Content Integration is tasked with overseeing content strategy and integration for ESPN Original Content which includes 30 for 30, ESPN+ Content, and special documentaries under the Director of Original Content Development & Integration. The position is charged with a range of responsibilities from contributing to the full content strategy, effective and essential content partnerships internally and externally, to managing integration and promotional opportunities for the brands under the Original Content group. Strong preference for someone who has previous and current experience working with filmmakers and strong industry relationships.
Responsibilities:
Creation, organization, and execution of promotional plans (i.e. internal and cross-departmental integration) around ESPN Original Content projects including 30 for 30 and ESPN+ content.

Our Customer’s mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through their family of apps and services, they are building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together.
We are seeking a Product Marketing Manager on a contract basis to help and support our client's ongoing business needs.

What you’ll do:
Lead market assessment based on quantitative analysis, qualitative feedback, and market view

Identify and evaluate long-term opportunities based on research, quantitative analysis, deep understanding of technologies, and a strategic view of the industry and its business models

Collaborate with product managers, synthesize insights to develop actionable product strategies and investment recommendations to execute on

Articulate and validate partner value proposition and establish a quantitative business case (i.e. ROI/TCO/NPV)

Develop a go-to-market strategy (market prioritization, pipeline, goals)

Create positioning collateral (i.e. pitch, objection handling, case studies)

Be a part of cross-functional planning and execution to support product launches and scaled adoption efforts globally


Develop product and partner growth playbook in partnership with Product, Data Science, and other teams (i.e. growth levers, tactics, prioritization, metrics)

Manage pilots (i.e. define scope, roll-out strategy, recruit partners and support evaluation of results)

Support Partnerships teams globally as a subject matter expert to enable partner success and best practices adoption

Partner with Marketing and other cross-functional teams to scale adoption through channel partners and drive key outbound marketing activities (i.e. participation in key industry events)


5-10 years of experience working in product marketing, product management, management consulting, product strategy, or equivalent function (partnered with product management and/or engineering on strategy and go-to-market).

Quantitative analytical experience in decision-making with large data sets and quantitative analysis.

Experience as an enterprise product marketer.

Experience influencing and developing strategic partnership products and programs at a global scale.

Experience collaborating and leading cross-functionally, including building consensus among multiple stakeholders in an entrepreneurial, high-expectation environment.

Highly organized, a resourceful and action-oriented individual with experience driving focus, clarity, and prioritization.

Communication and presentation skills.

Experience in the field of connectivity.

Outbound marketing skills.

Brand management skills.

Technical management skills.


BS/BA degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or related discipline.

MBA preferred.


M-F, 40 hours/week. This role will be remote while COVID restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at our Customer’s Menlo Park CA office once it is determined safe to do so.
Perks are available through our 3rd Party Employer of Record (Available upon completion of waiting period for eligible engagements)

Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, FSA, Commuter Benefit Program.

Up to 15 days per 12 months on assignment.

Up to $4,000 for the birth or adoption of a child while on assignment (conditions apply).

In order to create a safe, productive work environment, our client is requiring all contractors to be fully vaccinated according to the CDC guidelines (please inform your employer if you need a medical or religious exemption). If you love the outdoors and want to be part of a fast-growing consumer app, you're in the right place.
The role
We're looking for an experienced Brand Marketing Lead to drive engagement with The Dyrt's platform and owned channels. You'll oversee campaigns and partnerships across key owned channels, including PR, email, and social media. Primary metrics will be return platform visitors and brand awareness. You'll report to the Head of Growth Marketing, and will lead a team of brand and email marketing experts.

BQE Software is hiring a Product Marketing Manager to help us position our products in such a way that they sell themselves. The best products are those that seem to be created specifically for us, as if they were built it to satisfy the unique demands of a single user. The Product Marketing Manager will help us arrive at a deep understanding of the problems that our customers face on an individual level and position the unique way in which BQE can solve these problems.
You will speak with our existing customers to understand the problems that they were facing that drove them to select BQE as their preferred solution, the reason that they chose BQE over the other options in the market, the degree to which BQE solves the problems they face, and ways in which we can improve our offering to provide even more value. You’ll interview previous customers and prospects that did not purchase to learn where our offering fell short so that we can understand how our product and positioning can be improved. You’ll know our competitors like the back of your hand, with a deep understanding of their offerings and their position in the market. You’ll also know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make decisions and what drives them to initiate a buying conversation in the first place. You’ll be the glue that binds product to marketing to sales to service as you collaborate across all teams, ensuring that our messaging and positioning is consistent and is closely aligned with our offering and customer needs.

What sets you apart from other Product Marketing Managers is you’re an excellent translator! You can speak with the Product team as if you are part of the Product team. You are a market expert and have a deep understanding of how Saas works, and your ability to take that knowledge and translate it into verbiage that helps your internal and external customers understand the value proposition you bring to them makes you an invaluable strategic partner on any team you are part of.
You are a whiz when it comes to conducting market research, developing comprehensive messaging documents, providing sales enablement tools and product feature training. You understand priorities and high-level requirements with the roadmap and clients’ needs.
You are an entrepreneur at heart. You thrive in a fast-paced environment with lots of change. You have experience working with high growth software organizations and your enthusiasm and ability to stay on task in stressful situations makes you someone people can count on both at work and in your personal life. Your natural communication approach is one that effectively, respectfully, and inclusively builds a sense of belonging among employees who differ from one another. You are a strategic thinker and are proactive problem solver and you find ways to cohesively support employees and business drivers.

Associate Director, Product Marketing
At Curriculum Associates, we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. Indeed is searching for a Marketing Analytics Manager to join our team in Austin, TX or remote. This new member would be part of a fast-paced Brand Strategy and Insights team that consists of campaign planning, full-cycle research to support insight generation, and the measurement of campaign outcomes to optimize and improve the returns on our brand investment. In this role, you will partner with key stakeholders such as Global Advertising, PR, and Creative to develop a strong measurement strategy combining analytical insights and business acumen to improve the return on our brand marketing investments across channels. Although this role sits within the marketing organization, we collaborate with teams across Indeed to help drive our business forward and by measuring progress against our KPIs.

We are looking for an experienced marketing analytics professional with a data-centric mindset to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, with a proven aptitude and desire to drive marketing efficiencies through data-driven decisions and automation. You will ensure proper collection of data across different marketing departments to understand their KPIs and help them analyze their results by providing insights into what is working, what isn’t, and how we can action off our learnings to ensure continuous improvement.

Job Title: Product Strategy and Marketing Manager, SMB Products
Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. This role connects to that vision by helping small businesses and creators grow through products such as Business Accounts and Promote. CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

Job Title: Acquisition Marketing Manager (100% Remote, Must work PST)
Job Description:
Our client is seeking an exceptionally talented Acquisition Marketing Manager who can leverage digital expertise in planning, execution, and optimization of growth focused campaigns across our marketing channels. As an Acquisition Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for optimizing and elevating our customer acquisition and engagement marketing. This role focuses on the development of paid marketing initiatives and subsequent execution. You will analyze channel performance, recommend strategy, and lead initiatives to grow and optimize the channel. You will manage and report ongoing performance and influence multiple stakeholders cross-functionally to drive optimizations that will help improve top of the funnel reach and output metrics of acquisition KPIs. The impact of this role is significant and broad, accounting for a large percentage of Photos KPIs.
The successful candidate will have strong analytical skills, problem solving skills and a strong good understanding of digital marketing. The candidate will need to leverage their proven track record of leading as well as executing marketing initiatives, while managing to a paid media budget encompassing multiple marketplaces. In addition, ability to work with an analytics team, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to understand overall marketing strategy is key. Experience in GTM initiatives and partnering with product teams will further drive success in this role.

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

Job Title: Product Strategy and Marketing Manager, SMB Products
Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. This role connects to that vision by helping small businesses and creators grow through products such as Business Accounts and Promote. This role will be a part of the Product Strategy and Marketing team, a function that supports product development from beginning to end, including driving product strategy, support product launches and manage direct growth channels to SMB audiences.
This role will act as "COO" of the product and lead a broad set of efforts including driving product strategy, managing product rollout, defining marketing strategy and implementing growth programs.

Your Job
Indeed is searching for a Marketing Analytics Manager to join our team in Austin, TX or remote. This new member would be part of a fast-paced Brand Strategy and Insights team that consists of campaign planning, full-cycle research to support insight generation, and the measurement of campaign outcomes to optimize and improve the returns on our brand investment. In this role, you will partner with key stakeholders such as Global Advertising, PR, and Creative to develop a strong measurement strategy combining analytical insights and business acumen to improve the return on our brand marketing investments across channels. Although this role sits within the marketing organization, we collaborate with teams across Indeed to help drive our business forward and by measuring progress against our KPIs.

We are looking for an experienced marketing analytics professional with a data-centric mindset to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, with a proven aptitude and desire to drive marketing efficiencies through data-driven decisions and automation. You will ensure proper collection of data across different marketing departments to understand their KPIs and help them analyze their results by providing insights into what is working, what isn’t, and how we can action off our learnings to ensure continuous improvement.

Your Job
As a Associate Product Marketing Manager, you ensure our employers understand that Indeed has everything they need to make their next great hire. From attracting job seekers to screening for qualified applicants to interviewing candidates, employers can do all their hiring on Indeed. We’re looking for a Associate Product Marketing Manager who can leverage market insights to deliver impactful positioning, messaging, and go to market strategy for our flagship product. You will play a key role in driving Indeed’s next $1 billion in revenue alongside Product, Sales, Client Success, and User Experience.
Responsibilities
Represent the voice of the customer
Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story.

As a Content Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing compelling content to educate and engage providers in risk adjustment program participation and execute on initiatives designed to drive program expansion. Responsibilities include delivering high-impact provider training materials (PowerPoint decks, information sheets, case studies, website, videos), strategy development for program adoption, reporting to key business stakeholders on progress against content development and distribution, and working closely with other internal provider enablement teams to align on outreach tactics and support high-priority requests as needed.

The ideal candidate will have strong writing skills, experience developing content for a provider audience, the ability to consume program details and output clear and easily consumable messaging, experience working in a matrixed organization, strong interpersonal skills, comfortability with stakeholder management, understanding of health care, and a strong work ethic.

Marketing Manager

The Marketing Manager will coordinate and lead marketing functions for the company, working closely with senior management, the sales management team, and the company s agency and retained contractors. Oversee and/or coordinate with the members of the Company s marketing staff, including employees, contractors, and agencies.
Provide industry and product trends and insights, and concept ideation to sales and management
Extract key selling points from Nielsen and create consumer insights with compelling stories through data and graphs for sales and marketing team and management.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

You may not know, but our products are part of everyday life for everyone, even you. We're a small company that's big business. If you're looking to put your love of coffee to work, keep reading. Chances are you may have used our products this morning at Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, or Tim Hortons on your morning coffee run. THE ORGANIZATION
The Union Square Business Improvement District DBA The Union Square Alliance (Alliance) is a 501(c)(4) non-profit organization that serves members and creates a high-quality visitor experience by managing and activating public spaces, attracting new investment, and advocating for the Alliance’s future success. Funding for the Alliance comes from property tax assessments ($6.3mil/year) over a 27-block area around Union Square in San Francisco as well as donations, sponsorships, and grants. The Alliance’s objectives are to improve safety and security in the district; increase its cleanliness; enhance the visitor experience and the beauty of the area; define and brand the neighborhood; activate our public spaces; promote the district and the businesses located within it; provide a welcoming environment for visitors; help people effectively navigate the district; increase the economic viability of the area; and create an ideal place to live, work, and visit through maintenance and public safety measures, marketing, advocacy, streetscape improvements and public realm initiatives.

Job Title: Product Strategy and Marketing Manager, SMB Products
Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. Your Job
Indeed is searching for a Marketing Analytics Manager to join our team in Austin, TX or remote. This new member would be part of a fast-paced Brand Strategy and Insights team that consists of campaign planning, full-cycle research to support insight generation, and the measurement of campaign outcomes to optimize and improve the returns on our brand investment. In this role, you will partner with key stakeholders such as Global Advertising, PR, and Creative to develop a strong measurement strategy combining analytical insights and business acumen to improve the return on our brand marketing investments across channels. Although this role sits within the marketing organization, we collaborate with teams across Indeed to help drive our business forward and by measuring progress against our KPIs.

We are looking for an experienced marketing analytics professional with a data-centric mindset to join our team. The ideal candidate has strong analytical skills, with a proven aptitude and desire to drive marketing efficiencies through data-driven decisions and automation. You will ensure proper collection of data across different marketing departments to understand their KPIs and help them analyze their results by providing insights into what is working, what isn’t, and how we can action off our learnings to ensure continuous improvement.

Your Job
As a Associate Product Marketing Manager, you ensure our employers understand that Indeed has everything they need to make their next great hire. From attracting job seekers to screening for qualified applicants to interviewing candidates, employers can do all their hiring on Indeed. We’re looking for a Associate Product Marketing Manager who can leverage market insights to deliver impactful positioning, messaging, and go to market strategy for our flagship product. You will play a key role in driving Indeed’s next $1 billion in revenue alongside Product, Sales, Client Success, and User Experience.
Responsibilities
Represent the voice of the customer
Our Marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world discover Indeed. Whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in Indeed's labor data, Indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share Indeed’s story.

As a Content Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing compelling content to educate and engage providers in risk adjustment program participation and execute on initiatives designed to drive program expansion. Responsibilities include delivering high-impact provider training materials (PowerPoint decks, information sheets, case studies, website, videos), strategy development for program adoption, reporting to key business stakeholders on progress against content development and distribution, and working closely with other internal provider enablement teams to align on outreach tactics and support high-priority requests as needed.

The ideal candidate will have strong writing skills, experience developing content for a provider audience, the ability to consume program details and output clear and easily consumable messaging, experience working in a matrixed organization, strong interpersonal skills, comfortability with stakeholder management, understanding of health care, and a strong work ethic.

Marketing Manager

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

THE ORGANIZATION
The Union Square Business Improvement District DBA The Union Square Alliance (Alliance) is a 501(c)(4) non-profit organization that serves members and creates a high-quality visitor experience by managing and activating public spaces, attracting new investment, and advocating for the Alliance’s future success. Funding for the Alliance comes from property tax assessments ($6.3mil/year) over a 27-block area around Union Square in San Francisco as well as donations, sponsorships, and grants. The Alliance’s objectives are to improve safety and security in the district; increase its cleanliness; enhance the visitor experience and the beauty of the area; define and brand the neighborhood; activate our public spaces; promote the district and the businesses located within it; provide a welcoming environment for visitors; help people effectively navigate the district; increase the economic viability of the area; and create an ideal place to live, work, and visit through maintenance and public safety measures, marketing, advocacy, streetscape improvements and public realm initiatives.

Job Title: Acquisition Marketing Manager (100% Remote, Must work PST)
Job Description:
Our client is seeking an exceptionally talented Acquisition Marketing Manager who can leverage digital expertise in planning, execution, and optimization of growth focused campaigns across our marketing channels. As an Acquisition Marketing Manager, you’ll be responsible for optimizing and elevating our customer acquisition and engagement marketing. This role focuses on the development of paid marketing initiatives and subsequent execution. You will analyze channel performance, recommend strategy, and lead initiatives to grow and optimize the channel. You will manage and report ongoing performance and influence multiple stakeholders cross-functionally to drive optimizations that will help improve top of the funnel reach and output metrics of acquisition KPIs. The impact of this role is significant and broad, accounting for a large percentage of Photos KPIs.
The successful candidate will have strong analytical skills, problem solving skills and a strong good understanding of digital marketing. The candidate will need to leverage their proven track record of leading as well as executing marketing initiatives, while managing to a paid media budget encompassing multiple marketplaces. In addition, ability to work with an analytics team, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to understand overall marketing strategy is key. Experience in GTM initiatives and partnering with product teams will further drive success in this role.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School Of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Associate Director to lead our Marketing team.

The Associate Director of Marketing will report to the Vice President of Business Development and maintain responsibility for leading marketing and website/digital communication activities aimed at achieving CU Medicine brand awareness and community practice brand growth. The individual in this position will oversee a broad range of marketing and communication activities to promote, enhance and protect the brand reputation of CU Medicine.


Requires a minimum of 10 years marketing and communication experience with at least 5yrs in a leadership position. Must possess a solid understanding of digital technology, industry trends and overall knowledge of the media landscape. Health care experience is highly preferred and prior advertising agency experience may be helpful. Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree is a plus. The ideal candidate is persuasive, collaborative and detail oriented with demonstrated success and expertise in executing cross-channel marketing tactics to drive patient engagement (i.e. social and digital media, advertising and communications platforms, content creation, and website content management). Must have a solid understanding of paid, earned and owned media integration. Requires an expertise in understanding marketing channel performance and how results support business objectives. The ability to synthesize best practices and quickly implement learnings to strengthen in-market plans is key. Must be a self-motivated, outcomes-focused individual who holds herself/himself to a high performance standard, while maintaining a sense of proportion and humor.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

THE ORGANIZATION
The Union Square Business Improvement District DBA The Union Square Alliance (Alliance) is a 501(c)(4) non-profit organization that serves members and creates a high-quality visitor experience by managing and activating public spaces, attracting new investment, and advocating for the Alliance’s future success. Funding for the Alliance comes from property tax assessments ($6.3mil/year) over a 27-block area around Union Square in San Francisco as well as donations, sponsorships, and grants. The Alliance’s objectives are to improve safety and security in the district; increase its cleanliness; enhance the visitor experience and the beauty of the area; define and brand the neighborhood; activate our public spaces; promote the district and the businesses located within it; provide a welcoming environment for visitors; help people effectively navigate the district; increase the economic viability of the area; and create an ideal place to live, work, and visit through maintenance and public safety measures, marketing, advocacy, streetscape improvements and public realm initiatives.
